trans-unit.source: Represents a security token provider that provides <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security tokens for a SOAP message sender.

In most instances the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider> class doesn't need to be called directly, as it is called when a client sends a SOAP message that requires a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token.

Specifically, a client specifies the type of security token needed using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method to get a security token.

When the security token needed is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%28System.TimeSpan%29> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider"></xref> class using the specified service principal name.
This constructor sets the impersonation level that is allowed by a client to <xref:System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel>`Identification`.
The current context of the calling thread (<xref:System.Net.CredentialCache.DefaultNetworkCredentials%2A>) is used as a client identity.
The service principal name to get a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token for.
servicePrincipalName is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider"></xref> class using the specified service principal name and whether a client allows a recipient of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token to impersonate the client's credentials.
The current context of the calling thread (<xref:System.Net.CredentialCache.DefaultNetworkCredentials%2A>) is used as a client identity.
The service principal name to get a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token for.

A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel"></xref> that specifies the degree to which a recipient of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token can act on behalf of the client.
tokenImpersonationLevel is not `Identification` or `Impersonation`.
servicePrincipalName is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider"></xref> class using the specified service principal name, client identity, and whether a client allows a recipient of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token to impersonate the client's credentials.
The service principal name to get a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token for.

A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel"></xref> that specifies the degree to which a recipient of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token can act on behalf of the client process.
tokenImpersonationLevel is not `Identification` or `Impersonation`.
servicePrincipalName is `null`.
Gets a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method is called by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class when a client sends a SOAP message and a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token is needed.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that specifies the timeout value for the message that gets the security token.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the security token to get.
Gets the identity of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token.

When the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider.NetworkCredential%2A> property is `null` and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method is called, the current context of the calling thread (<xref:System.Net.CredentialCache.DefaultNetworkCredentials%2A>) is used as a client identity.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkCredential"></xref> that represents the identity of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref>.
Gets the service principal name of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token to get.
The service principal name of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token to get.
Gets a value that specifies the degree to which a recipient of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token can act on behalf of the client.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider.TokenImpersonationLevel%2A> property must be either `Identification` or `Impersonation`.

A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel"></xref> that specifies the degree to which a recipient of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token can act on behalf of the client.
